router.description: Single-level dispatch. Input maps directly to section(s). No nested routing, no priority queue. Multiple sections activate in parallel when task spans domains.
router.note: This is a structural demo showing 4 of 10 sections. Full router covers all KB sections.

trigger_patterns: is this a concept or instrument
what will participants be able to do
sections_demo.note: Activates on every design task regardless of other triggers. Result typing is mandatory before structure begins.
sections_demo.output: Typed result: Concept | Instrument | Resource + rationale

trigger_patterns: why would they do this exercise
sections_demo.note: Activates on every exercise design task. No exercise is produced without a myth frame. Iron rule.
sections_demo.output: Exercise card: myth narrative + task + debrief structure

sections_demo.note: Format selection is always downstream of result typing. Activates after RESULT_TYPES confirms the outcome type.
sections_demo.output: Format recommendation with structure template and result-type compatibility note

sections_demo.note: Diagnostic section. Activated when a program is already designed and showing failure signals, or when a request arrives with a pre-built structure that needs review.
sections_demo.output: Antipattern identification + correction algorithm + redesign entry point

dispatch_logic.description: How the router resolves a real request
steps: 2. Match against trigger_patterns across all sections (parallel scan)
4. Add always_active sections (RESULT_TYPES, PSYCHOTECHNICAL_MYTH) if not already present
dispatch_logic.conflict_resolution: No conflicts in flat architecture. All activated sections contribute independently. Synthesis is the role's responsibility, not the router's.

example_dispatch.input: I want to create an exercise for my webinar where participants practice giving feedback
example_dispatch.reasoning: Exercise creation → PSYCHOTECHNICAL_MYTH. Webinar context → FORMAT_STRUCTURES. Result typing mandatory → RESULT_TYPES always active.
example_dispatch.first_action: Clarify result type before exercise design. Is 'giving feedback' a Concept (understand what good feedback is), Instrument (apply a specific feedback model), or Resource (habitual practice)? Answer changes exercise design.
